posts.title: Javascript
posts.description: often abbreviated as JS, is an interpreted programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification
posts.author: Sandy

posts.title: ECMAScript
posts.description: is a scripting-language specification standardized by Ecma International in ECMA-262 and ISO/IEC 16262. It was created to standardize JavaScript to help foster multiple independent implementations.
posts.author: John

posts.title: Angular
posts.description: Angular puts you in control over scalability. Meet huge data requirements by building data models on RxJS, Immutable.js or another push-model.
posts.author: John

posts.title: VueJS
posts.description: Is an open-source Model–view–viewmodel JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications.
posts.author: Sandy

posts.title: ReactJS
posts.description: It is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It is maintained by Facebook and a community of individual developers and companies
posts.author: John

posts.title: PostCSS
posts.description: PostCSS is a software development tool that uses JavaScript-based plugins to automate routine CSS operations.
posts.author: John

posts.title: NodeJS
posts.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside of a browser.
posts.author: Sandy

posts.title: JSON
posts.description: is an open-standard file format or data interchange format that uses human-readable text to transmit data objects consisting of attribute–value pairs and array data types (or any other serializable value).
posts.author: Alessia

posts.title: HTML
posts.description: Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser. It can be assisted by technologies such as Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) and scripting languages such as JavaScript.
posts.author: Alessia

posts.title: SQL
posts.description: Structured Query Language is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system (RDBMS), or for stream processing in a relational data stream management system (RDSMS).
posts.author: Alessia

posts.title: MongoDB
posts.description: MongoDB is a cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like documents with schema. MongoDB is developed by MongoDB Inc. and licensed under the Server Side Public License (SSPL).
posts.author: John

posts.title: Git
posts.description: Git is a distributed version-control system for tracking changes in source code during software development
posts.author: John
